entry.title: Black Lives Matter 5280Party for Socialism and Liberation - PSL was live.Police agencies in the Denver area arrested anti-war organizers in...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280Party for Socialism and Liberation - PSL was live.

Police agencies in the Denver area arrested anti-war organizers in a coordinated assault today. People were arrested in a Home Depot parking lot, at their homes..., and after they were pulled over while driving. Those arrested were the leaders to demand justice for Elijah McClain, who was brutally murdered by the Aurora Police Department. They are still in jail, with the exception of one person. They are facing multiple felony charges and years in prison in an obvious frame-up aimed at stopping the movement for justice for Elijah McClain. Drop the charges!

Please join an Emergency Livestream tonight, Sept. 17th for updates on this developing situation, and the PSL‚Äôs plans to mobilize against this government attack.

See More

entry.title: Join Coloradans as we refuse to partner with Palantir by giving...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Join Coloradans as we refuse to partner with Palantir by giving them a hearty unwelcome!
The company, Palantir Technologies, is ICE‚Äôs technology backbone, providing the digital infrastructure to surveil, detain and deport immigrants. Palantir‚Äôs tools have been used to conduct mass workplace raids, including the biggest raid in US history in which 680 people were detained in Mississippi. Palantir moved its headquarters to Colorado this month. Let's show them that they are not ...welcome in our city and state! We will not let Palantir profile our people and separate our families.
Meet outside 1555 Blake Street at 4pm for a socially distant "Unwelcome Party"! MASKS REQUIRED! And Sign this petition to pledge your resistance to Palantir and ICE:
https://www.facebook.com/events/668864717052618/?acontext=%7B%22event_action_history%22%3A[%7B%22mechanism%22%3A%22search_results%22%2C%22surface%22%3A%22search%22%7D]%7D

Unwelcome Party for Palantir

entry.title: We keep hearing and reading that the ongoing pandemic has most...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

We keep hearing and reading that the ongoing pandemic has most drastically affected our communities, and many BIPOC are being effectively excluded from accessing relief funds based solely on technicalities. #BLM5280 is in a unique, unprecedented position to assist in allocating the funds we have received for #Covid19relief toward easy-to-access grant funding for BIPOC. Our communities stand to suffer the most in struggling to survive due to the effects of Covid-19 on our loca...l economy from which our elected officials have refused to protect us. There are too many wealthy neighborhood developers on the sidelines waiting to pounce on the opportunity to use Covid-19 as a vehicle for gentrification. We will not sit idly by while that happens when we have the means to help prevent it.

Please complete this google form with basic information about your family‚Äôs financial need, location, and how you can best receive our assistance. Funds will be disbursed via check whenever possible, but will also be made accessible to families who are not able to receive checks at this time. The maximum amount awarded to any family at one time will be $2500 to remain consistent with covering at least one month of the median single-family home cost of rent in Denver, CO currently. Applicants may reapply once, but first-time applicants will receive priority.

Seguimos siendo informados que la pandemia sigue afectado mas dr√°sticamente a nuestras comunidades y muchas BIPOC han sido efectivamente excluidos para obtener fondos de ayuda por errores t√©cnicos.. BLM5280 se encuentra en una posici√≥n √∫nica y sin precedentes para ayudar a distribuir los fondos que hemos recibido para auxilio de Covid-19 y se es f√°cil tener acceso a los fondos para BIPOC.
Nuestras comunidades sufren y luchan m√°s para sobrevivir debido a los efectos de Covid-19 en nuestra econom√≠a local por la cual los pol√≠ticos elegidos se han negado a protegernos. Hay demasiados compa√±√≠as de construcci√≥n de vecindarios para gente rica esperando la oportunidad de usar COVID-19 como un pretexto para gentrificaci√≥n. No nos quedaremos con los brazos cruzados viendo lo qu√© pasa cuando podemos ayudar a prevenir esa situaci√≥n.

Por favor llene este formulario de Google para obtener informaci√≥n de las necesidades econ√≥micas de su familia , direcci√≥n, y c√≥mo podemos darle ayuda. Los fondos ser√°n distribuidos por medio de cheques pero tambi√©n ser√° accesible para los que no pueden recibir cheques. La cantidad m√°xima otorgada a una familia es $2,500. Actualmente es el costo de alquiler de una casa para una familia en Denver, CO. Solicitantes pueden pedir ayuda otra vez pero los que solicitan por primera vez tendr√°n prioridad.

https://docs.google.com/‚Ä¶/1FAIpQLSfRWyksu7rQ7s5aOv‚Ä¶/viewform

entry.title: Diana is a solid member of the BLM5280 community and they have...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Diana is a solid member of the BLM5280 community and they have decided to help raise funds along with helping her apply for assistance. Diana is also an appreciated member of the QTPoC community in Denver Metro Area. (She has documented our beautiful community and always supported the local drag performers).
We are taking into account the history of medical racism and homophobia in our community, we are incredibly resilient! Diana is one of the most resilient people we know, seriously... she's been through her fair share of hospitalizations. Her body is working hard to go into remission and to be safe at home while she recovers from a successful bone marrow transplant. Anything you can give toward meeting her goal would be greatly appreciated! #doitforDiana

https://www.gofundme.com/f/qwoc-help-diana-beat-cancer‚Ä¶

HELP LOCAL QWOC RECOVER! ‚ò∫ If you have Venmo send funds directly to her @ Diana_Guardad‚Ä¶ R Araceli Torres needs your support for Help Diana QWOC Beat Cancer

entry.title: These atrocities our immigrant siblings are facing are...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

These atrocities our immigrant siblings are facing are unconscionable. We are physically ill over this latest revelation. Detention centers ARE concentration camps. Words have meaning, and we need to normalize calling them what they are. This article reminds us that with fascism things are always far worse than they seem. If the phrase ‚ÄòUS concentration camps‚Äô doesn't sit right with you support Abolish ICE Denver even harder. This is yet another affront to all of our humanity, and the Immigrant Community needs all of us now more than ever. #FreeThemAll #AbolishIce

CW: internal genital mutilation, eugenics, genocide

https://www.google.com/‚Ä¶/u-s-concentration-camp-sent-u‚Ä¶/amp/

entry.title: On #SexWorkerPrideDay this Sunday, September 13th we celebrate....
entry.content:
On #SexWorkerPrideDay this Sunday, September 13th we celebrate.
We celebrate sex workers’ self-determination.
We celebrate sex workers’ enhanced visibility.
We celebrate the achievements of sex worker led organizations.
We celebrate and we keep the fight for decriminalization going until it is won.
#Sexworkiswork#decriminalizesexwork

entry.title: #CallToAction...
entry.content:
#CallToAction
HAPPENING NOW: Your mayor and council members are meeting to discuss the 2-year contract with #DenverPoliceDepartment that increases their budget in the second year. This budget increase allows for MORE funds devoted to the chemical weapons they terrorize our city with! They plan to quietly vote on it tomorrow 9/3 with only online public comment that they can control the narrative on with the click of a button. Contact your council member and Michael B. Hancock TODAY and let them know as their constituent you DEMAND they do not support the following:

‚ùåAny Collective Bargaining Agreement with DPD longer than 1 year.

‚ùåAny agreement that gives ANY financial increases or incentives to police.

‚ùåAny agreement that does not require police to be financially responsible for their attorneys and settlements in any cases of alleged excessive force or race related discrimination

#DEFUNDPOLICE #DEFENDBLACKLIFE

entry.title: Peace and blessings, family. Securing justice for our communities is critical. Still, we must never normalize watching...
entry.content: Peace and blessings, family. Securing justice for our communities is critical. Still, we must never normalize watching and reading about any violence enacted on our friends and loved ones, pieces of ourselves, on the internet. We give thanks to the ancestors and higher power that guided #JacobBlake back to share more joyful moments with his children like the one in this picture we are intentionally sharing instead of that horrific video. Today we are reminded that it is an essential component of #Blackliberation to take pause and hold space for our whole selves —body, mind, and spirit. To choose healing. #Blackhealingisrevolutionary #BlackLivesMatter

entry.title: From @denverpsl: On August 21, 1971, the murder of revolutionary George Jackson at San Quentin State Prison ignited what...
entry.content:
From @denverpsl: On August 21, 1971, the murder of revolutionary George Jackson at San Quentin State Prison ignited what we celebrate today as #BlackAugust. Black August, first commemorated by our incarcerated brothers and sisters, is a time to recommit ourselves to the struggle for #BlackLiberation and to honor those who’ve contributed to our collective progress and all those who have been lost to unjust violence and systemic racism.
This August 21, join us in a car protest to bring the Black August fight to our local prison walls. We will drive in a mobile protest to the Denver County Jail and the GEO Aurora ICE detention facility to let those who are chained there know that we are with them, we are fighting for them, and we will keep fighting until all chains are broken.
The many injustices faced by those behind bars in the U.S. are today amplified by the COVID-19 pandemic. Prisons and jails all across the country, where medical neglect is commonplace and quarantining impossible, have become hotspots of infection. Hundreds have died in US prisons from COVID-19, and yet no response has been made to defend against unnecessary death. The mass incarceration of Black, Brown, and Indigenous populations means that they are not only disproportionately affected by the virus outside of jail, but inside as well.
We raise the following demands, recognizing that if they are not met, more unnecessary death is a certainty:
1. Immediate humanitarian release of all ICE detainees and all vulnerable inmates, those convicted for non-violent offenses, and those who have not been convicted at all.
2. Where people remain behind bars, drastically increase medical staffing and supplies to local jails and state prisons, and guarantee sanitary conditions for all inmates.
3. Free all political prisoners!
#FreeThemAll #DecarcerateNOW #decarcerateCOVID19

entry.title: Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will continue to share links to bail/legal support fundraising in Denver, Minneapolis and beyond. We encourage friends to donate to BLM5280‚Äôs Emergency Fund using Venmo http://venmo.com/BLM5280 . These donations will be used for bail, legal support, and provision of direct services for Black people impacted by the current and ongoing crisis. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation that we will have access to at a later date, you can visit our Colorado Gives Day Page to donate through our fiscal sponsor, Rocky Mountain Peace and Justice Center.

Working with residents and organizations in Denver, Black Lives Matter 5280 assists in building more loving and united Black communities while eliminating anti-Black violence and racism.
